title: Welcome to Basalt University
content:
# Welcome to Basalt University

## Purpose
Basalt University is your central hub for all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), training modules, and internal guides. Whether you are an administrator, content editor, or operations manager, this knowledge base will help you navigate and utilize the full power of BasaltCMS.

## Navigation
- **General**: High-level overviews and company policies.
- **CMS Editing**: Guides on using the content editor, managing blogs, and pages.
- **Technical**: Advanced configuration and troubleshooting.
- **Vendor Ops**: Managing vendor compliance, onboarding, and documents.
- **AI & Automation**: Using the Voice Agent and AI Builder tools.

## Role-Based Learning Paths
To help you get started quickly, follow the path that matches your role:

### ðŸŽ“ Content Editors
Focus on creating and managing content.
1.  **Using the Visual Content Editor**
2.  **Blog Content Management SOP**
3.  **Media Library Best Practices**
4.  **Landing Page Creation SOP**

### ðŸ› ï¸ Administrators
Focus on system config and user management.
1.  **Managing Headers**
2.  **OAuth & BYOK Setup Guide**
3.  **Connecting Third-Party Apps**
4.  **Analytics Interpretation Guide**

### ðŸ“‹ Ops & Compliance
Focus on external partners and legal.
1.  **Vendor Onboarding SOP**
2.  **Career Posting SOP**

## Terminology
- **Slug**: The URL-friendly version of a title (e.g., `my-page-title`).
- **SOP**: Standard Operating Procedure.
- **VCMS**: Vendor Compliance Management System.
- **BYOK**: Bring Your Own Key (using your own API keys for AI services).
- **Puck**: The name of our visual block-based editor.

## Getting Help
If you cannot find what you are looking for, please contact the IT support team or raise a ticket in the Support portal.

title: Using the Visual Content Editor
content:
# Using the Visual Content Editor

## Overview
The BasaltCMS Visual Editor allows you to create stunning landing pages and articles without writing a single line of code. It uses a drag-and-drop interface powered by the **Puck** editor.

## Getting Started
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Landing Pages** or **CMS > Blog**.
2.  Click **Create New** or select an existing item to edit.
3.  Click the **"Edit Visual"** button to launch the Puck editor.

## Component Deep Dive
Key properties for our most popular blocks:

| Component | Key Properties | usage Tip |
|-----------|----------------|-----------|
| **Hero** | `Title`, `Subtitle`, `Background Image`, `CTA` | Use high-res images with dark overlays for text readability. |
| **Feature Grid** | `Columns` (2-4), `Icons`, `Cards` | Best for displaying 3-6 key selling points. |
| **Rich Text** | `Content` (Markdown) | Use for long-form text. Supports headers, lists, and links. |
| **Call to Action** | `Headline`, `Button Text`, `Link` | Place at the bottom of pages to drive conversion. |

## Keyboard Shortcuts
Speed up your workflow with these hotkeys:
- `Cmd/Ctrl + Z`: **Undo** last action.
- `Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + Z`: **Redo** last action.
- `Cmd/Ctrl + S`: **Save** changes (local draft).
- `Delete/Backspace`: **Remove** selected component.

## Draft vs. Published
Understanding the lifecycle of your content:

### Draft State
- Changes are saved locally or to a "draft" slot in the database.
- **Not visible** to public visitors.
- Perfect for work-in-progress.

### Published State
- The "Live" version of the page.
- Clicking **Publish** pushes your current Draft to Production.
- **Audit Log**: Every publish event is recorded in the Activity Log for accountability.

## Mobile Preview
Always test responsiveness before publishing:
1.  Click the **device icons** in the editor toolbar.
2.  Toggle between Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile views.
3.  Check that content reflows properly on smaller screens.

title: Managing Headers
content:
# Managing Headers

## Overview
The Header Management system allows you to fully customize the top navigation bar of your website directly from the CMS. You can add links, nested dropdowns, and organize the structure without code changes.

## Accessing the Header Editor
1. Navigate to **CMS > Header** in the sidebar (under the "Left Menu" or "Design" section).
2. You will see a tree view of your current header structure.

## Adding Navigation Items
1. Click the **Add Item** button.
2. Choose the type of item:
   - **Link**: A direct link to a page (e.g., `/pricing`).
   - **Dropdown**: A container for sub-items (e.g., "Resources").
3. Enter the **Label** (text displayed) and **URL** (for links).

## Mobile Responsiveness
How headers behave on mobile devices:
- Top-level items become the main list in the hamburger menu.
- **Dropdowns** become collapsible accordions.
- **Best Practice**: Ensure dropdown labels are short and clear to fit on mobile screens.

## Mega Menus
For complex site structures:
- While the UI shows a simple list, creating a "Dropdown" with *many* children can function as a mega-menu column.
- **Limit Depth**: We recommend a maximum nesting depth of 2 levels (Header > Dropdown > Link) for usability.

## Publishing Changes
Changes made in the Header Editor do not go live immediately.
1. Review your structure in the preview.
2. Click the **Publish Header** button to deploy updates to the live site.

> [!TIP]
> Keep your top-level menu items to a maximum of 5-7 for best usability.

title: Product Showcase Management
content:
# Product Showcase Management

## Overview
The Product Showcase is a specialized section for highlighting key product features with high-fidelity animations and descriptions. This is often used on the homepage or "Features" page.

## Managing Items
1. Navigate to the **Product Showcase** module in the CMS.
2. You can **Add**, **Edit**, or **Delete** showcase items.

## Animation Formats
Choose the right format for your visual:
- **Lottie (JSON)**: Best for vector illustrations. Small file size, scales infinitely.
- **GIF/Video**: Best for UI captures or complex footage. Heavier file size.
- **CSS Animation**: Best for simple state changes. Lowest performance impact.

## Hydration Safety
> [!WARNING]
> **Client-Side Only**: Complex animations often require access to the `window` object.

If you see "Hydration Mismatch" errors:
- Ensure your animation component is wrapped in a `<ClientOnly>` helper or dynamically imported with `ssr: false`.
- The CMS handles this automatically for standard formats, but be careful when embedding custom code.

## Best Practices
- **Consistency**: Keep titles and descriptions of similar length across items.
- **Visuals**: Use high-quality assets. If using animations, ensure they are optimized for web performance.
- **Ordering**: Place your most impactful feature first.

title: AI Builder & Voice Agent
content:
# AI Builder & Voice Agent

## AI Builder
The AI Builder allows you to construct custom AI workflows and helpers.

### Creating a New Agent
1. Go to **CMS > AI Builder**.
2. Click **Create Agent**.
3. Define the **System Prompt** (the instructions for the AI).
4. Select the **Model** (e.g., GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet).
5. Test the agent in the playground window.

## Prompt Engineering Pro-Tips
To get the best results from your agent:
- **Assign a Persona**: "You are an expert copywriter with 10 years of experience."
- **Use Delimiters**: "Separate sections with markdown horizontal rules."
- **Provide Examples**: Give the AI examples of the desired output format (One-shot prompting).

## Token Usage Strategy
AI costs are based on "Tokens" (text segments).
- **Input Tokens**: What you send to the AI (Context).
- **Output Tokens**: What the AI writes back.
- **Strategy**: Keep system prompts concise. Use the "Clear Context" button in chats when starting a new topic to avoid sending full history.

## Voice Agent (Beta)
BasaltCMS includes a Universal Voice Agent capable of real-time voice interaction.

### Enabling Voice
1. Ensure your browser has **Microphone Permission** allowed for the CMS domain.
2. Click the **Microphone Icon** in the sidebar or command palette.
3. Speak naturally to the agent.

> [!WARNING]
> Voice features consume significant tokens. Monitor your usage in the **Settings > Billing** section.

title: OAuth & BYOK Setup Guide
content:
# OAuth & Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) Setup

## Overview
BasaltCMS allows you to connect your own email providers (Gmail, Outlook) and AI models (OpenAI, Anthropic) using a "Bring Your Own Key" architecture.

## AI Model Configuration
1.  Go to **Settings > AI Agent**.
2.  Select your provider (e.g., OpenAI).
3.  Enter your **API Key** in the secure field.
4.  Click **Verify & Save**.

## Troubleshooting
Common connection issues:
- **Invalid API Key**: Double-check for whitespace when pasting.
- **Insufficient Quota**: Ensure your OpenAI/Anthropic account has credit balance (separate from ChatGPT subscription).
- **Permissions**: Verify the API key has permission to access the requested models (e.g., `gpt-4`).

## Security Architecture
How we protect your keys:
- **AES-256 Encryption**: Keys are encrypted before writing to the database.
- ** decryption**: Keys are only decrypted in memory on the server during an API call.
- **No Client Access**: Keys are never sent to the browser front-end.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Your API keys are encrypted at rest using AES-256. We never share your keys with third parties.

title: Vendor Onboarding SOP
content:
# Vendor Onboarding SOP

## Purpose
This SOP outlines the standard procedure for onboarding a new vendor into BasaltCMS using the VCMS tools.

## Pre-requisites
- You must have a digital image of the vendor's business card OR a W9 form.

## Process

### 1. Vendor Scanning
1.  Go to **CMS > Media Library**.
2.  Click the **"Vendors"** tab in the top right.
3.  Click **"Scan Card"** (or drop the image file).
4.  The AI will process the image for approx. 5-10 seconds.
5.  Once complete, a new profile is created in **CMS > Vendors**.

### 2. Validation & Review
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Vendors**.
2.  Locate the new vendor (likely marked `AMBIGUOUS`).
3.  Click to open the profile.
4.  Verify the extracted data against the original card.
5.  If correct, change status to **VALIDATED**.

## Common Rejection Reasons
If AI scanning fails or provides poor results:
- **Blurry Image**: Re-take the photo.
- **Glare**: Ensure no reflections block the text.
- **Handwriting**: AI struggles with handwritten notes on cards.

## Manual Override
If you cannot scan a card:
1.  Go to **CMS > Vendors**.
2.  Click **Create New** (Manual).
3.  Type in the details yourself.
4.  Upload the card image as a "Document" later for record-keeping.

title: Connecting Third-Party Apps
content:
# Connecting Third-Party Apps

## Overview
The **Apps & Plugins** system allows you to connect external platforms (like Shopify, WooCommerce, and WordPress) directly to your CMS.

## How to Connect an App

1.  **Navigate to Apps Store**
    - Go to **CMS > System > Apps & Plugins**.
2.  **Select a Provider**
    - **Shopify**: Enter store URL. Approve OAuth.
    - **WooCommerce**: Provide Consumer Key/Secret.
    - **WordPress**: Enter URL and Application Password.
3.  **Verification**
    - Indicator turns **Green (Connected)**.

## Webhook Debugging
If updates aren't appearing:
1.  Check the **App Logs** tab in the app details.
2.  Look for `400` or `500` error codes.
3.  Ensure your store's webhook settings point to `https://[your-cms-url]/api/webhooks/[provider]`.

## Sync Frequency
- **Real-time**: Webhooks capture changes immediately (e.g., new order).
- **Scheduled**: Product catalogs sync every 24 hours.
- **Manual**: Clicking "Sync Now" forces an immediate update.

## Security Note
All API keys and tokens are encrypted using AES-256 before being stored. We strictly log all access.

title: Blog Content Management SOP
content:
# Blog Content Management SOP

## Purpose
Standard procedure for creating, editing, and publishing blog posts.

## Creating a New Blog Post

### Step 1: Access Blog Module
1.  Navigate to **CMS > Blog** > **Create New +**.

### Step 2: Fill in Post Details
- **Title**: Compelling headline.
- **Slug**: Auto-generated (SEO friendly).
- **Content**: Write full article.

## SEO Pre-flight Checklist
Before hitting publish, verify:
1.  [ ] **Title Tag**: Is it under 60 characters?
2.  [ ] **Meta Description**: Is it under 160 chars and compelling?
3.  [ ] **URL Slug**: Is it clean? (e.g., `best-cms-guide` vs `post-123`).
4.  [ ] **Headings**: Is there only ONE `h1` tag? Are H2/H3s nested correctly?
5.  [ ] **Images**: Do all images have Alt Text?

## Author Management
By default, the logged-in user is the author.
- **Change Author**: Admins can select a different user as the author from the "Settings" sidebar in the editor.
- **Guest Authors**: Create a "Guest" user account if you need to attribute external writers.

## Publishing Workflow
1.  **Save as Draft** while working.
2.  **Publish** when ready.
3.  **Preview** immediately to ensure formatting is correct.

title: Landing Page Creation SOP
content:
# Landing Page Creation SOP

## Purpose
Creating marketing landing pages using the Puck visual editor.

## Conversion Optimization (CRO) Tips
To maximize leads/sales:
- **Above the Fold**: Ensure your Headline and primary CTA are visible without scrolling.
- **Social Proof**: Place testimonials or logos *before* the pricing section.
- **One Goal**: A landing page should have *one* primary action (e.g., "Sign Up"). Remove distracting links.
- **Speed**: Use optimized images to keep load times under 2 seconds.

## Building Your Page
Using the Puck Editor:
1.  Drag components (Hero, Features, Pricing).
2.  Configure properties.
3.  Check mobile responsiveness.

## Template Customization
Don't start from scratch every time.
1.  Build a perfect page structure.
2.  Click **Save as Template** in the page settings.
3.  Name it (e.g., "Webinar Registration 2024").
4.  Next time, select this template when creating a new page.

title: WordPress Sync Workflow
content:
# WordPress Sync Workflow

## Purpose
Synchronizing content between BasaltCMS and WordPress.

## Conflict Resolution
What happens if content is edited in both places?
- **BasaltCMS wins**: When you click "Sync to WordPress", the CMS content *overwrites* the WordPress content.
- **No Locking**: Currently, we do not lock the WordPress editor. Coordinate with your team to avoid overwriting changes made directly in WP.

## Bi-directional Limitations
- **CMS -> WP**: Full Content, Title, Featured Image, Slug.
- **WP -> CMS**: Content (converted to Blocks), Title, Date.
- **Not Synced**: Comments, Plugin-specific metadata, Custom Fields (ACF) typically require custom mapping logic.

## Importing from WordPress

### Import Posts
1.  Go to **My WP Site** > **Posts**.
2.  Click **Import**.

### Import by URL
1.  Paste any WordPress URL.
2.  The system scrapes and converts HTML to Puck Blocks.

## Troubleshooting

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Connection failed | Verify App Password (not user password). |
| "JSON Error" | Check if a security plugin is blocking REST API. |
| Images 404 | Ensure original WP images are publicly accessible during import. |

title: Newsletter Campaign SOP
content:
# Newsletter Campaign SOP

## Purpose
Creating and sending newsletter campaigns.

## Spam Avoidance Strategy
Keep your domain reputation high:
- **Authenticate**: Ensure DKIM/SPF records are set up for your sending domain.
- **Avoid Triggers**: Don't use all caps, excessive exclamation marks!!!, or words like "FREE", "CASH".
- **Unsubscribe**: Link is automatically added. Never hide it.

## Segment Logic
Targeting the right users:
- **AND Condition**: `Role is CEO` AND `Industry is Tech`. (Matches fewer people, highly specific).
- **OR Condition**: `Role is CEO` OR `Role is CTO`. (Matches more people, broader).

## Creating a Campaign
1.  **Configure**: Subject, Preheader, From Name.
2.  **Content**: Rich text body.
3.  **Recipients**: Select segment.
4.  **Test**: Always send a test email to yourself first.

title: FAQ Management SOP
content:
# FAQ Management SOP

## Purpose
Creating and organizing FAQ content.

## Voice & Tone
FAQs are a customer service touchpoint.
- **Empathy**: Acknowledge the user's potential frustration.
- **Direct**: Answer the "Yes/No" immediately, then explain.
- **Simple**: Avoid jargon. Use "you" and "we".

## Rich Media in FAQs
Sometimes text isn't enough.
- **Images**: Paste screenshots directly into the markdown editor.
- **Video**: Use standard markdown video embeds or links to tutorials.
- **Links**: Link deeper into documentation for complex answers.

## Organizing
- **Categories**: Group by topic (Billing, Tech, General).
- **Order**: Put the most asked questions at the top (Drag & Drop).

## AI Assistance
Use the Sparkles icon to:
- **Generate** questions from a topic.
- **Expand** a rough bullet point into a full answer.
- **Rephrase** for clarity.

title: Career Posting SOP
content:
# Career Posting SOP

## Purpose
Managing job listings and applications.

## Hiring Pipeline Integration
BasaltCMS can push applicants to your ATS.
- **Email**: Default. New apps arrive in the HR email inbox.
- **Webhook/Zapier**: Set up a webhook in **Apps** to push data to Slack, Greenhouse, or Lever.

## Legal Disclaimers
Protect the company:
- **EEO Statement**: Always include an Equal Employment Opportunity statement footer.
- **Privacy**: Link to the candidate privacy policy.
- **Salary Range**: In some jurisdictions (CA, NY, CO), disclosing salary range is required by law.

## AI-Assisted Content
1.  Click **Sparkles** within the job editor.
2.  Prompt: "Senior React Engineer, remote, $140k".
3.  AI writes the full JD including requirements and perks.

title: Media Library Best Practices
content:
# Media Library Best Practices

## Purpose
Organizing and optimizing media assets.

## Format Guide
When to use what:
- **JPG**: Photographs, real-world scenes. (Good compression).
- **PNG**: Graphics with transparency, logos, sharp text/lines.
- **WebP**: Modern standard. Best balance of quality & size. Use whenever possible.
- **SVG**: Icons, logos. Infinite scalability, tiny size.

## Folder & Tagging Strategy
Keep your library sane:
- **Naming**: `[category]-[name]-[size].jpg` (e.g., `blog-ai-guide-cover.jpg`).
- **No Spaces**: Use hyphens.
- **Organization**: Use the built-in tabs (Public, My Files) effectively.

## AI Features
- **SEO**: Auto-generate alt text and captions.
- **Vendor Scan**: Extract data from business cards.

## Optimization
- Aim for file sizes < 200KB for large images.
- Use the CMS's built-in resizing when serving images (handled by Next.js Image component).

title: Analytics Interpretation Guide
content:
# Analytics Interpretation Guide

## Purpose
Using analytics to improve content strategy.

## Engagement Score Formula
How do we determine "Top Posts"?
Currently, the system uses a simple weighted sum:
`Score = (Clicks * 1) + (Shares * 5)`
*Shares are weighted higher because they represent a stronger endorsement than a click.*

## Actionable Insights

| Observation | Diagnosis | Action |
|-------------|-----------|--------|
| **High Clicks, Low Shares** | Good title, weak content. | Improve article depth, add "Tweet this" quotes. |
| **Low Clicks, High Shares** | Bad title, amazing content. | Rewrite the headline (A/B test). |
| **Low Clicks, Low Shares** | Topic mismatch. | Review audience interests, check SEO keywords. |

## Restore Defaults
Use the restore button to clear custom date filters and sort orders if the dashboard looks incorrect.
